results.t: What are Materials? | Different Materials - Twinkl

results.p: A material is a substance or mixture of substances that constitutes an object. Materials can be pure or impure, living or non-living matter.

results.t: Materials | An Open Access Journal from MDPI
results.p: Materials is an international peer-reviewed, open access journal on materials science and engineering published semimonthly online by MDPI.

results.t: MATERIAL | definition in the Cambridge English Dictionary
results.p: a type of physical thing, such as wood, stone, or plastic, having qualities that allow it to be used to make other things.
The meaning of MATERIAL is relating to, derived from, or consisting of matter; especially : physical. How to use material in a sentence.
Materials science is an interdisciplinary field of researching and discovering materials. Materials engineering is an engineering field of finding uses for ...
Materials definition: the equipment necessary for a particular activity. See examples of MATERIALS used in a sentence.
Material is synonymous with Substance, and is anything made of matter - hydrogen, air and water are all examples of materials. Sometimes the term Material is ...
noun. the substance or substances of which a thing is made or composed: Stone is a durable material. anything that serves as crude or raw matter to be used or ...
The Materials Project provides open web-based access to computed information on known and predicted materials as well as powerful analysis tools.

results.t: MATERIALS | definition in the Cambridge English Dictionary
results.p: equipment that you need for a particular activity: "Do we need any writing materials?" "Only a pen and a pencil."
